subject: Climate & Environment
title: Why Floods Are Getting Worse
description: A 60-second lesson on Why Floods Are Getting Worse.

hook.text: In 2022, one-third of Pakistan was underwater. 33 million people were displaced.

buildup.text: Warmer air holds 7% more moisture per degree, fueling heavier downpours everywhere.

discovery.text: Paving over land with concrete prevents water from soaking in, sending it rushing into streets.

twist.text: Deforestation removes the sponge effect â€” bare slopes channel water into deadly flash floods.

climax.text: Flood damage worldwide has quadrupled since the 1980s, even adjusted for inflation.

punchline.text: We paved the land, warmed the sky, and wonder why floods worsen.

quiz.question: How much more moisture does warmer air hold per degree of warming?
